title: Conservation Practices Commonly Used in Animal Agriculture

tasks.task: Clean Water and Clean Air Acts Compliance through Conservation Practices
subtasks: Manage and prevent nutrients and pathogens from impacting natural resources
Implement manure management practices (diversions, roofs, gutters)
Store manure to avoid runoff and nutrient losses
Apply manure to fields when it's economical and environmentally safe
Implement land and pasture management practices (prescribed grazing, access control)
Use nutrient management plans to optimize crop production
Create buffers or filter strips to trap runoff and protect water bodies
Use windbreaks around barns or lots to reduce odors
Plan for animal mortality and manage dead animals to prevent resource contamination

tasks.task: Document and manage Comprehensive Nutrient Management Plan (CNMP)
subtasks: Collect and store manure nutrients according to CNMP guidelines
Apply manure nutrients on fields using farm and field mapping
Ensure manure is not over-applied and kept away from sensitive areas

tasks.task: Technical and Financial Assistance from NRCS
subtasks: Receive assistance for implementing conservation practices (manure, land, mortality management)
Apply for grants from Agencies like EPA to accelerate conservation practice adoption
Coordinate with state and local governments for additional regulations and guidelines
